medical_history.chief_complaint: Generalized lipodystrophy associated with heterozygous LMNA p.T10I mutation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients exhibited generalized loss of subcutaneous fat during childhood, with symptoms varying in onset from infancy to around 14 years. Symptoms included mottled skin pigmentation, joint contractures, and metabolic disturbances such as diabetes and hypertriglyceridemia. Worsening metabolic symptoms and complications, including cardiac issues, were noted over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous diagnoses included diabetes mellitus, acanthosis nigricans, hypertriglyceridemia, and hepatomegaly. Patients also had comorbidities like joint contractures and cardiomyopathy, with some requiring cardiac transplants.
medical_history.family_history: The father of one patient was also reported to have similar symptoms including generalized loss of subcutaneous fat and cardiac issues.
